item.title: WezTerm
item.description: I found a new terminal: WezTerm. Not as fast as Alacritty it’s still GPU accelerated and has some great features. WezTerm combines two important aspects: Alacritties speed and iTerms/GNOME Terminals tabs. It sure isn’t as fast as Alacritty, but in my daily usage, I hardly notice any differences. Noteworthy features: GPU accelerated tabs good font support (it supports ligatures as well) easy theming simple configuration (via a wezterm.lua file in $HOME/.

item.title: Podman All the Things
item.description: A few days ago while browsing lobste.rs I stumbled upon the article “Dock Life: Using Docker for All The Things!" written by Andrew Welch. It had then gotten onto the upper half of the first page on lobste.rs and a few days ago even Chris Coyer from CSS-Tricks.com wrote about it. Just coming from NixOS and Fedora Silverblue, I was immediately hooked. This is actually an amazing idea! Basic Idea The basic idea behind Andrew Welch’s article is simple: If you ever need to run a certain program, grab a container that already includes the desired program and remap the program name on your system to a docker run command.

item.title: DNF Config
item.description: The DNF package manager posses a config file under /etc/dnf/dnf.config. A few interesting options are available and not set per default. # force the usage of fastest mirror available fastestmirror=True # enable parallel downloads to speed up downloads max_parallel_downloads=10 # enable colored output color="always"
